{\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. href=\"/component/solr/\">Advanced Search</a></div>\n        </form>\n    </div>\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\">\n\tjQuery(function ($) {\n\t    var source = function (request, callback) {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div class=\"wrap\">                                  </div>                  \n              </div>\n                    </header>\n\n        <main class=\"aa\" id=\"main\">\n\n            <!--div class=\"wrap\">\n             <p>Message placeholder</p>\n            </div-->\n\n            \n            \n              \n              \n            \n            \n            <div class=\"wrap\" >\n                              \n<div class=\"breadcrumbs\">\n\n\n\n<a href=\"/\" class=\"pathway\">Home</a> <img src=\"/media/system/images/arrow.png\" alt=\"\"  /> <a (2021) A83</a> <img src=\"/media/system/images/arrow.png\" alt=\"\"  /> <span>Full HTML</span></div>\n\n              \n                                                    <div id=\"content\" data-edps_ref=\"aa39462-20\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\"           \r\n  \r\n \r\n  <div class=\"module_title\">\n    <a href=\"/\">Homepage</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"nav-section\"><div class=\"title_toc\">\n<ul class=\"menu browse\">\n<li name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n align=\"left\">Total</td>\n<td align=\"center\">312 (<b>293</b>)</td>\n<td align=\"center\">939 (<b>888</b>)</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8211;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8211;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8211;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8211;</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8211;</td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> From left to right: number of multiply-imaged systems, total number of multiple images, global rms of the model, Einstein radius at <i>z</i>&#8196;=&#8196;4, total enclosed mass within the Einstein radius, global velocity dispersion measured from the lens model or the cluster dynamics. Numbers in boldface are confirmed with spectroscopy.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\" data-edps_ref=\"aa39462-20\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n (2012)</a></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"left\">SMACS J2131.1&#8722;4019</td>\n<td align=\"center\">21:31:04.831</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8722;40:19:20.92</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.442</td>\n<td align=\"center\">MACS</td>\n<td align=\"center\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html#R91\">Repp &amp; Ebeling (2018)</a></td>\n</tr>\n<tr>\n<td align=\"left\">MACS J2214.9&#8722;1359</td>\n<td align=\"center\">22:14:57.292</td>\n<td align=\"center\">&#8722;14:00:12.91</td>\n<td align=\"center\">0.502</td>\n<td align=\"center\">MACS</td>\n<td align=\"center\"><a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html#R37\">Ebeling et al. (2007)</a></td>\n</tr>\n</tbody>\n</table>\n      </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> The reference WCS location corresponds to the brightest cluster member of the (sub-)cluster targetted by the MUSE observations. We mention in the notes whether the target belongs to the MACS, Frontier Fields (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html#R77\">Lotz et al. 2017</a>) or CLASH (<a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html#R90\">Postman et al. 2012</a>) surveys, as well as other relevant publications about preliminary mass models or known lensed arcs in these clusters prior to the MUSE observations. The rightmost columns give the reference to the lens model used to design the MUSE observations.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\" data-edps_ref=\"aa39462-20\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. The current usage metrics is available 48-96 hours after online publication and is updated daily on week days.</p>\n\n\t<div class=\"msg msg-info\">\n\t\t<span class=\"ico ico-info\"></span>\n\t\t<div>\n\t\t\t<p>Initial download of the metrics may take a while.</p>\n\t\t</div>\n\t</div>\n\n\n</div>\n\n\n\n\n</div>\n<script type=\"text/javascript\" src=\"/templates/source/js/metrics-tab.js\"></script>\n\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\n\n                                                    </div>\n                        <nav class=\"article\">\n                           \r\n  \r\n \r\n  <div class=\"module_title\">\n    <a href=\"/\">Homepage</a>\n</div>\n<div class=\"nav-section\"><div class=\"title_toc\">\n<ul class=\"menu browse\">\n<li name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n Redshifts with error bars are not constrained with spectroscopy and are predictions from our lens model.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\" data-edps_ref=\"aa39462-20\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"metrics-siq\">Current usage metrics</button>\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"info\">About article metrics</button>\n    \n\t\n\t<button class=\"toolbar-item\" id=\"return\">Return to article</button>\n</nav>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-siq\">\n</div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"metrics-alm\"></div>\n\n<div class=\"panel\" data-for=\"info\">\n\t\n\n\t<p>Current usage metrics show cumulative count of Article Views (full-text article views including HTML views, PDF and ePub downloads, according to the available data)  and Abstracts Views on Vision4Press platform.</p>\n\n\t<p>Data correspond to usage on the plateform after 2015. name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div                    \n                                              <div class=\"flexme flexme-article\">\n                        <div class=\"article-content\">\n spectroscopic table for the two sources presented in Fig. <a href=\"/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html#F6\">6</a>.</p>\n      <div class=\"tab\">\n        <table width=\"100%\"    </div>\n      <div class=\"history\">\n<p><b>Notes.</b> From left to right: source identification and origin of catalog (PRIOR, MUSELET or EXTERN), sky coordinates, redshift and confidence level, HST photometry in all bands, redshift measurements and errors from <tt>pyplatefit</tt> for each family of spectral lines, magnification and error estimate, and multiple image identification.</p>\n</div>\n    </div>\n  \n\r\n</div>\r\n\r\n    <div id=\"metrics-tabs\" data-doi=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\" data-edps_ref=\"aa39462-20\">\n<nav class=\"toolbar\">\n\t<button Edouard Belin, 31400 Toulouse, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Johany Martinez\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author\" content=\"Vera Patr\u00edcio\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_author_institution\" content=\"Univ Lyon, Univ Lyon1, ENS de Lyon, CNRS, Centre de Recherche Astrophysique de Lyon UMR5574, 69230 Saint-Genis-Laval, France\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_title\" content=\"An atlas of MUSE observations towards twelve massive lensing clusters\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_online_date\" content=\"2021/02/12\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_publication_date\" content=\"2021/02/01\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_volume\" content=\"646\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_firstpage\" content=\"A83\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_doi\" content=\"10.1051/0004-6361/202039462\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_bibcode\" content=\"2021A%26A...646A..83R\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_fulltext_html_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/full_html/2021/02/aa39462-20/aa39462-20.html\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_pdf_url\" content=\"https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2021/02/aa39462-20.pdf\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"0004-6361\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_issn\" content=\"1432-0746\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_language\" content=\"en\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: distances and redshifts\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: high-redshift\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"techniques: imaging spectroscopy\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"gravitational lensing: strong\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: formation\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_keyword\" content=\"galaxies: clusters: general\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_article_type\" content=\"Research Article\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_abstract\" lang=\"en\" content=\"&lt;i&gt;Context.&lt;i/&gt; Spectroscopic surveys of massive galaxy clusters reveal the properties of faint background galaxies thanks to the magnification provided by strong gravitational lensing.&lt;i&gt;Aims.&lt;i/&gt; We present a systematic analysis of integral-field-spectroscopy observations of 12 massive clusters, conducted with the Multi Unit Spectroscopic Explorer (MUSE). All data were taken under very good seeing conditions (\u223c0\u2033\u200b\u200b.6) in effective exposure times between two and 15 h per pointing, for a total of 125 h. Our observations cover a total solid angle of \u223c23 arcmin&lt;sup&gt;2&lt;sup/&gt; in the direction of clusters, many of which were previously studied by the MAssive Clusters Survey, Frontier Fields (FFs), Grism Lens-Amplified Survey from Space and Cluster Lensing And Supernova survey with &lt;i&gt;Hubble&lt;i/&gt; programmes. The achieved emission line detection limit at 5&lt;i&gt;\u03c3&lt;i/&gt; for a point source varies between (0.77\u20131.5) \u00d7 10&lt;sup&gt;\u221218&lt;sup/&gt; erg s&lt;sup&gt;\u22121&lt;sup/&gt; cm&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt; at 7000 \u00c5.&lt;i&gt;Methods.&lt;i/&gt; We present our developed strategy to reduce these observational data, detect continuum sources and line emitters in the datacubes, and determine their redshifts. We constructed robust mass models for each cluster to further confirm our redshift measurements using strong-lensing constraints, and identified a total of 312 strongly lensed sources producing 939 multiple images.&lt;i&gt;Results.&lt;i/&gt; The final redshift catalogues contain more than 3300 robust redshifts, of which 40% are for cluster members and \u223c30% are for lensed Lyman-&lt;i&gt;\u03b1&lt;i/&gt; emitters. Fourteen percent of all sources are line emitters that are not seen in the available HST images, even at the depth of the FFs (\u223c29 AB). We find that the magnification distribution of the lensed sources in the high-magnification regime (&lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;\u2004=\u20042\u201325) follows the theoretical expectation of &lt;i&gt;N&lt;i/&gt;(&lt;i&gt;z&lt;i/&gt;) \u221d &lt;i&gt;\u03bc&lt;i/&gt;&lt;sup&gt;\u22122&lt;sup/&gt;. The quality of this dataset, number of lensed sources, and number of strong-lensing constraints enables detailed studies of the physical properties of both the lensing cluster and the background galaxies. The full data products from this work, including the datacubes, catalogues, extracted spectra, ancillary images, and mass models, are made available to the community.\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_funding_source\" content=\"citation_funder=ERC; citation_grant_number=336736;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=V. Abril-Melgarejo;citation_author=B. Epinat;citation_author=W. Mercier;citation_publication_date=2021;citation_journal_title=A&amp;A;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=A. Acebron;citation_author=E. Jullo;citation_author=M. Limousin;citation_publication_date=2017;citation_journal_title=MNRAS;citation_volume=470;citation_firstpage=1809;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=T. P. Robitaille;citation_publication_date=2013;citation_journal_title=A&amp;A;citation_volume=558;citation_firstpage=A33;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=H. Atek;citation_author=J. Richard;citation_author=J.-P. Kneib;citation_publication_date=2015;citation_journal_title=ApJ;citation_volume=800;citation_firstpage=18;\">\n  <meta name=\"citation_reference\" content=\"citation_author=H. Atek;citation_author=J. Richard;citation_author=J.-P. Kneib;citation_author=D. {\n\t        var term = request.term;\n            $.ajax({\n                url: '/index.php',\n                dataType: 'json',\n                method: 'GET',\n                data: {\n                    option: 'com_solr',\n                    task: 'auto_complete',\n                    query: term\n                },\n                success: function (data) {\n                    var suggestions = [];\n                    try {\n                        data.suggest.default[term].suggestions.forEach(function (s) { suggestions.push(s.term)}) } catch (e) {\n                    }\n\n                    callback(suggestions);\n                },\n                error: function (err) {\n                    callback([]);\n                }\n            });\n        };\n\n\t\t$('#search').find('input[name=q]').autocomplete({\n\t\t\tsource: source\n\t\t});\n\t});\n</script>\n\n                          <div class=\"header-cover\">\n                <div
